name: New Incentives
headline: Cash transfers that save lives.
description: New Incentives implements cash transfer programs that save lives. We encourage Nigerian mothers to immunize their infants to protect them against deadly diseases.
generated_description:
**New Incentives: Saving Lives Through Cash Transfers**

**Mission:** New Incentives is on a mission that speaks volumes: "Cash transfers that save lives." This nonprofit organization is focused on improving childhood vaccination rates by encouraging Nigerian mothers to immunize their infants against preventable diseases.

**Founded and Location:** Established as part of Y Combinator’s S16 batch, New Incentives is headquartered in San Francisco. With a dedicated team of 51 employees, they are leveraging technology and data to amplify their impact.

**What They Do:** Their approach is straightforward but highly effective: New Incentives provides cash incentives to families after their children receive vaccinations at government clinics. This isn’t just about handing out cash; it’s about creating a reliable system that ensures children get the care they need. They also help raise awareness about vaccination benefits and work to improve local vaccine supply chains.

**Measured Impact:** The results are compelling:
- Over 4.5 million infants have been served by their program.
- Nearly 19 million cash transfers have been issued after vaccination verification.
- A stunning 86% retention rate ensures that families remain engaged throughout the vaccination cycle.

In independent trials, New Incentives demonstrated significant increases in vaccination coverage:
- A 108% increase in full vaccination rates.
- A 62% increase in timely measles vaccinations.
- A 180% improvement in clinics avoiding stockouts of vaccines.

With data updated daily, it’s clear that New Incentives is making strides where it matters most, addressing child mortality rates in Nigeria—where approximately 40% of deaths among children under five are due to vaccine-preventable diseases.

**Why It Matters:** Every 19 seconds, a child dies from a vaccine-preventable disease. New Incentives tackles this grim reality head-on, proving that financial incentives can align public health goals with urgent humanitarian needs.

**Funding and Recognition:** This organization has garnered recognition from esteemed charity evaluators and funders, attaining vital support that allows them to operate effectively while striving to be one of the most cost-effective charities in the world.

If you're interested in learning more or wish to support their mission, visit [New Incentives' website](http://www.newincentives.org) for more information.
